item.title: Report E-2025060316
item.description:
Report E-2025060316

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-10
  • City: WESTAMPTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment arrived to A. Duie Pyle with several nails protruding from the pallet. As the dockworker was unloading the pallet, the leak was spotted. Immediate action was taken to identify the punctured jerrican and mitigate the spill. It was a small amount leaked out of the jerrican as the nail plugged the hole. The spill clean-up materials and damaged container were placed in separate overpack containers in preparation for disposition.

item.title: Report E-2025060361
item.description:
Report E-2025060361

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-10
  • City: WESTAMPTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The freight was shipped to A. Duie Pyle on poor quality pallets. The pallet had a nail protruding from it resulting in the unintentional release of 1 liter of corrosive liquid. Immediate action was taken to mitigate the spill when it was discovered. The damaged jerrican was placed in an overpack container. The clean up materials were placed in a separate overpack container in preparation for disposition.

  • Description: Shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. 1 fiberboard box containing 2 class bottles, in plastic bags that were zip tied. One of two 0.5L glass bottles leaked completely from the metal cap. All remaining contents were placed in salvage drum and held for disposition from the customer.

item.title: Report E-2025050542
item.description:
Report E-2025050542

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-27
  • City: WESTAMPTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was reconsigned back to its origin. Upon reloading the freight, the loader failed to properly secure the cargo resulting in it shifting forward causing the pallet to lean. The excess pressure created by the shift caused a small leak in one of the containers which was discovered as the freight was being staged on the dock. Once discovered, the spill was neutralized and cleaned up with absorbents. The damaged container and cleanup materials were placed in separate overpack containers in preparation for disposition.

item.title: Report E-2025060017
item.description:
Report E-2025060017

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-25
  • City: LODI
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES TECH LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. They observed approximately fifty (50) gallons of material released from one (1) plastic IBC tote due to a load shift damaging the tote. Clean Harbors completed the tote transfer and left the tote onsite. A new crew came from Clean Harbors and brought sixteen (16) bags of granular absorbents. They deployed granular absorbents to the affected area of the trailer floor and asphalt. Three areas of asphalt were affected in the parking lot. After clean-up procedures were completed, the generated waste consisted of two (2) totes and eight (8) 55-gallon drums of waste. The waste was staged on the corner at the back of the store's property. One week later the waste was transported to the ESTES Pine Brook terminal where it will remain for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.
